description: Ms. codex. Title from first text (fol. 2b). Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in large naskh, in black ink with use of red. Headings in red and green, a few in yellow. Dark cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible. Lower part of leaves severely worm-eaten, with some loss of text. Fol. 1 and endpaper after fol. 109 are later additions. Short text by another hand as the main text on fol. 1b and 109b. Inscription in Arabic script on fol. 1a: "numrah 361".
abstract: Collection of fourteen texts of the Druze community, being the first part of their sacred texts (see end of vol., fol. 115a). It comprises texts 1-14 in Sylvestre de Sacy's description in Exposé de la religion des Druzes (1838).
contents: 1. fol. 2a-8b: Nuskhat al-sijill alladhī wujida muʻallaqan ʻalá al-mashāhid fī ghaybat mawlānā al-imām al-Ḥakīm.
2. fol. 8b-9b: al-Sijill al-manhī fīhi ʻan al-khamr.
9. fol. 39a-47b: Risālat al-Balāgh wa-al-nihāyah fī al-tawḥīd ilá kāfat al-muwaḥḥidīn al-mutabarriyīn min al-talḥīd.
11. fol. 58a-69a: Kitāb fīhi ḥaqāʼiq mā yaẓharu quddām Mawlānā jalla dhikruhu min al-hazl.
14. fol. 97b-109b: Sabab al-asbāb wa-kunz li-man ayqana wa-istajāba.
extent: 109, i leaves: paper ; 195 x 150 (140 x 110) mm. bound to 200 x 160 mm.

binding_note: Brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Both covers are similarly blind tooled with a central roundel encompassing a star pattern, with two square pendants on the vertical axis. Large border consisting of a guilloche, fillets, and a running pattern. Similar border on the envelope flap, with on its point a roundel encompassing a flower pattern, and garlanded by radiating flecks. Paper pastedown.
